t: For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song.
Praise*pn awaits you, our God, in Zion; to*ld you our vows will be fulfilled.
You*ln who answer prayer, to*ld you all people will come.
When*ln we were overwhelmed by sins, you*ld forgave our transgressions.
Blessed*ln are those you choose and*ld bring near to live in your courts! We*ln are filled with the good things of your house, of*ld your holy temple.
You*pn answer us with awesome and righteous deeds, God*ld our Savior, the*ln hope of all the ends of the earth and*ld of the farthest seas,
who*ln formed the mountains by your power, having*ld armed yourself with strength,
who*ln stilled the roaring of the seas, the*ld roaring of their waves, and*ld the turmoil of the nations.
The*ln whole earth is filled with awe at your wonders; where*ld morning dawns, where evening fades, you*ld call forth songs of joy.
You*pn care for the land and water it; you*ld enrich it abundantly. The*ln streams of God are filled with water to*ld provide the people with grain, for*ld so you have ordained it.
You*ln drench its furrows and level its ridges; you*ld soften it with showers and bless its crops.
You*ln crown the year with your bounty, and*ld your carts overflow with abundance.
The*ln grasslands of the wilderness overflow; the*ld hills are clothed with gladness.
The*ln meadows are covered with flocks and*ld the valleys are mantled with grain; they*ld shout for joy and sing.
